abstract: Shortly after Motorola disappointed shareholders and analysts by cutting its revenue forecasts and failing to make a bid for rival Palm, its biggest gadfly has increased his stake in the company. Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, increased his stake in the beleaguered cellphone maker to 2.7 percent from 2.48 percent, according to a regulatory filing made on Friday.
lead_paragraph: Shortly after Motorola disappointed shareholders and analysts by cutting its revenue forecasts and failing to make a bid for rival Palm, its biggest gadfly has increased his stake in the company. Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, increased his stake in the beleaguered cellphone maker to 2.7 percent from 2.48 percent, according to a regulatory filing made on Friday.
